<ce:section-title>Synthesis of [{CdCl<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>}<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(μ-tppz)].ethylene glycol</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">In a glass test tube, a solution of CdCl<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.04<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in 5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL 1:1 (V/V) ethanol/acetone was carefully layered on top of a solution of tppz (0.0388<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in 5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL chloroform using ethylene glycol (3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) as an interlayer. After 5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>days at room temperature, colorless single-crystals suitable for X-ray crystallography appeared at the boundary, in a yield of 22%. <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">26</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">22</ce:inf>Cd<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>Cl<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>: C, 38.21; H, 2.71; N, 10.28. Found: C, 38.55; H, 2.76; N, 10.39%. <ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>H NMR (<ce:italic>δ</ce:italic> ppm, 500<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>MHz, DMSO-d<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>, 298<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>K): 8.57 (d, 4H), 8.09 (d, 4H), 7.84 (dd, 4H), 7.59 (dd, 4H).</ce:para><ce:section-title>Synthesis of [Rh(tppz)(bpy)Cl][PF<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>]<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>.acetylacetone</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">A solution of tppz (0.37<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.95<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in 20<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL ethanol was slowly added to a solution of RhCl<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>·<ce:italic>x</ce:italic>H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.25<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.95<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in 25<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL ethanol. The mixture was heated at reflux temperature for 5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h while being stirred vigorously. Upon cooling, a fine brown–green powder product was precipitated and filtered out. The product was washed with cold ethanol followed by diethyl ether and air dried. The yield of [Rh(tppz)Cl<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>] was 0.493<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g (86.8%). A mixture of [Rh(tppz)Cl<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>] (0.298<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and 2,2′-bipyridine (0.078<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in 90<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL 2:1 (V/V) ethanol/water was heated at reflux temperature for 1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h. To the solution was then added AgNO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> (0.17<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and the resulting solution was stirred at reflux temperature for 1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h. The solution was cooled to −5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C overnight and filtered through Celite to remove the fine white AgCl precipitate. The filtrate was evaporated to dryness on the rotary evaporator. The brown powdery residue was dissolved in 20<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL water and precipitated from solution as a hexafluorophosphate salt by the addition of NH<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>PF<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf> (0.326<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol). The PF<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>
<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup> counter ion increased the solubility of the complex in polar organic solvents and resulted in easier purification. The product, [Rh(tppz)(bpy)Cl][PF<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>]<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> was collected by suction filtration, washed with cold water and diethyl ether, and air dried. The crude product was purified by column chromatography (alumina, grade IV, weakly acidic, 150 mesh with column dimensions: height 50<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm and diameter 3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>cm). Elution with 3:1 acetonitrile/toluene gave a yellow–green band, which was collected, evaporated to dryness, and then recrystallized by slow evaporation of a 1:1 acetonitrile/acetylacetone solution of the complex. After 4<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>days at room temperature, yellow–green single-crystals suitable for X-ray crystallography were formed in a yield of 63%. <ce:italic>Anal</ce:italic>. Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">39</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">32</ce:inf>ClF<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>P<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>Rh: C, 43.65; H, 3.00; N, 10.44. Found: C, 43.94; H, 2.97; N, 10.60%. <ce:sup loc="post">1</ce:sup>H NMR (<ce:italic>δ</ce:italic> ppm, 500<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>MHz, DMSO-d<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>, 298<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>K): 10.11 (d, 1H), 9.80 (d, 1H), 9.69 (1H, d), 9.56 (d, 1H), 8.78 (dd, 1H), 8.64 (d, 2H), 8.33 (dd, 1H), 8.16 (dd, 1H), 8.21 (d, 2H), 8.07 (d, 2H), 7.94 (dd, 2H), 7.83 (dd, 2H), 7.56 (dd, 1H), 7.45 (d, 2H), 7.30 (m, 4H).</ce:para>
clean_text:
Synthesis of [{CdCl2}2(μ-tppz)].ethylene glycol

In a glass test tube, a solution of CdCl2⋅H2O (0.04g, 0.2mmol) in 5mL 1:1 (V/V) ethanol/acetone was carefully layered on top of a solution of tppz (0.0388g, 0.1mmol) in 5mL chloroform using ethylene glycol (3mL) as an interlayer. After 5days at room temperature, colorless single-crystals suitable for X-ray crystallography appeared at the boundary, in a yield of 22%. Anal. Calc. for C26H22Cd2Cl4N6O2: C, 38.21; H, 2.71; N, 10.28. Found: C, 38.55; H, 2.76; N, 10.39%. 1H NMR (δ ppm, 500MHz, DMSO-d6, 298K): 8.57 (d, 4H), 8.09 (d, 4H), 7.84 (dd, 4H), 7.59 (dd, 4H).

Synthesis of [Rh(tppz)(bpy)Cl][PF6]2.acetylacetone

A solution of tppz (0.37g, 0.95mmol) in 20mL ethanol was slowly added to a solution of RhCl3⋅xH2O (0.25g, 0.95mmol) in 25mL ethanol. The mixture was heated at reflux temperature for 5h while being stirred vigorously. Upon cooling, a fine brown-green powder product was precipitated and filtered out. The product was washed with cold ethanol followed by diethyl ether and air dried. The yield of [Rh(tppz)Cl3] was 0.493g (86.8%). A mixture of [Rh(tppz)Cl3] (0.298g, 0.5mmol) and 2,2'-bipyridine (0.078g, 0.5mmol) in 90mL 2:1 (V/V) ethanol/water was heated at reflux temperature for 1h. To the solution was then added AgNO3 (0.17g, 1mmol) and the resulting solution was stirred at reflux temperature for 1h. The solution was cooled to -5°C overnight and filtered through Celite to remove the fine white AgCl precipitate. The filtrate was evaporated to dryness on the rotary evaporator. The brown powdery residue was dissolved in 20mL water and precipitated from solution as a hexafluorophosphate salt by the addition of NH4PF6 (0.326g, 2mmol). The PF6 - counter ion increased the solubility of the complex in polar organic solvents and resulted in easier purification. The product, [Rh(tppz)(bpy)Cl][PF6]2 was collected by suction filtration, washed with cold water and diethyl ether, and air dried. The crude product was purified by column chromatography (alumina, grade IV, weakly acidic, 150 mesh with column dimensions: height 50cm and diameter 3cm). Elution with 3:1 acetonitrile/toluene gave a yellow-green band, which was collected, evaporated to dryness, and then recrystallized by slow evaporation of a 1:1 acetonitrile/acetylacetone solution of the complex. After 4days at room temperature, yellow-green single-crystals suitable for X-ray crystallography were formed in a yield of 63%. Anal. Calc. for C39H32ClF12N8O2P2Rh: C, 43.65; H, 3.00; N, 10.44. Found: C, 43.94; H, 2.97; N, 10.60%. 1H NMR (δ ppm, 500MHz, DMSO-d6, 298K): 10.11 (d, 1H), 9.80 (d, 1H), 9.69 (1H, d), 9.56 (d, 1H), 8.78 (dd, 1H), 8.64 (d, 2H), 8.33 (dd, 1H), 8.16 (dd, 1H), 8.21 (d, 2H), 8.07 (d, 2H), 7.94 (dd, 2H), 7.83 (dd, 2H), 7.56 (dd, 1H), 7.45 (d, 2H), 7.30 (m, 4H).
